title: Ping Spikes latley?
body:
My first post so bear with me anyway

The last few days that I have been on my ping seems to spike a decent amount in the game at random time. Is anyone else having ping spike or lag problems that are unusual for you? ping is usually 70-80 will be normal then jump to 200-700+ ping for a few seconds to a few mins. 

Is anyone else having the same problem in game? I have met a few other people online having similar problems as me. My guess would be maybe Riot working on their servers to help ping spike or whatever they said they where going to do or riot gifting out the mystery skins may be lagging it? 

Or if it is on my end any solutions or what it may be / what to check?

Thanks in advance!

Caveat : I don't have any expertise in this area, just speaking as a player who has had similar problems.

There are some lightweight ping tools you can find online.  You can run them in the background, pinging a neutral location (like Google), to see if your ping spikes to League coincide with spikes to other places on the internet.  

I did this upon the advice of one of my colleagues and found out the issue was on my end/my ISP's.  Got a new cable modem and it has helped significantly.  Doesn't mean you will have the same luck, but it's likely worth looking into.

Hey Sotere, whenever the Technical Team does reply to these kinds of problems the usual response we get is that it is our ISP, but I don't think it's always fair to blame the ISP's of people since they are multi-billion dollar industries who know their networks than most times Dyrus tries to cook/use a microwave. Have you guys ever checked with the ISP for your server to see if there was a problem returning packets to a players computer? I have friends who have talked to their ISP and have done what you guys have instructed down to the technical changes in their modems and sometimes they still get lag so from their issues, my understanding is that maybe somewhere on the return trip from your server the packets are being holed up causing the lag. My college professor did always compare packet transfer between a computer and server to a highway since packets can travel either way to reach their destination, but also that sometimes blockages do occur at intervals among the connection between the server and computer.

These ping spikes in the severity they are in are rather new, getting between 280-3k ping spikes. Unless Verizon decided to do some fuckboy shit in my area im 100% sure that this has more to do with rito than it does Version. But ya know what I'll try this thing out and post back here later.
Bumping this now cause for the last three days, it's been nothing BUT lag spikes. It just went up to 5000 in my last match.
Bumping it because it stopped a few days after I posted this. Now 5.1 is out and back to lag spikes.... Riot whyy you do this to me xD

I have been having a similar problem I play league and it jumps from 50-80 ping to about 300-900 every other second and I haven't changed anything at where my computer is located. I tried restarting comp internet and even tried redownloading league. this is very recent and only popped up about 4 days ago. any fixes/reasons?

Lately I've been having what I like to call "stealth lag". Game is fine and then suddenly everything stops (minions, champs, towers, everything) and then there's a sudden fast forward experience. Followed by me usually being suddenly dead. It's hard enough, but when the other team wins and starts congratulating themselves for their skill, I makes me want to uninstall.
well ping and no spikes for 2 days now its back to dc's and 200 pings skyrocketing to 1000 again damnit were fed the hell up with this
I had heavy lag spikes too in the last 3 days. The game became unplayable,other services(streams,games) work fine.

Because they are building a NA network specifically for LoL. Should be done March'ish, but as your traffic gets bounced around differently as parts come online and get tweaked, you may get some spikes. I do.  (This is my understanding anyways)
